pullRequest.body:
Let $K$ be an algebraic number field of degree $h,$ and let $\beta_1, \ldots , \beta_h$ be an integer basis, so that every integer in $K$ has the unique representation $a_1\beta_1 + \ldots + a_h\beta_h$ where $a_1, \ldots , a_h$ are rational integers. 

We shall denote by ${\overline{\hspace{-1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{1pt}\alpha\hspace{1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{-1pt}}}$ the maximum of the modulus of the conjugates $\alpha^{(i)}$ with $(1 \leq i \leq h)$ of $\alpha,$ that is $${\overline{\hspace{-1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{1pt}\alpha\hspace{1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{-1pt}}}= \max_{1 \leq i \leq h} \left|\alpha^{(i)}\right|.$$ 

In the following we let $c$ be a natural number depending on $K$ and its basis $\beta_1, \ldots , \beta_h.$ 

It can be shown that if $\alpha$ is an algebraic integer with $\alpha = a_1\beta_1 + \ldots + a_h\beta_h,$ then $$\left|a _i\right| \leq  c \;{\overline{\hspace{-1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{1pt}\alpha\hspace{1pt}\smash[t]{|}\hspace{-1pt}}}·$$

Reference : Keng, Hua Loo. "Introduction to Number Theory.", page 489, Springer-Verlag (1982)

Thanks for your contribution and welcome to mathlib!

You can fix the third one (you need to update the file `Mathlib.lean` to mention your new file) by running `lake exe mk_all`, for example. (Currently, that script has a small bug on windows - let me know if this programm fails and I can run it for you.)
After these fixes, your PR should be ready for review!

Can you please add a reference in the standard mathematical literature?

I have the feeling that it would make more sense to do all of this using [NumberField.canonicalEmbedding](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/NumberField/CanonicalEmbedding/Basic.html#NumberField.canonicalEmbedding). Then, you could define the house of an algebraic number as the norm of its image by the canonical embedding, say
```lean
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.Basic

variable {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

noncomputable section

namespace NumberField

open Module.Free NumberField FiniteDimensional NumberField.canonicalEmbedding

abbrev House (α : K) : ℝ := ‖canonicalEmbedding K α‖

theorem House_eq_sup' (α : K) :
    House α = Finset.univ.sup' Finset.univ_nonempty (fun φ : K →+* ℂ ↦ ‖φ α‖₊) := by
  rw [House, ← coe_nnnorm, nnnorm_eq, ← Finset.sup'_eq_sup Finset.univ_nonempty]
```

Then, the matrix you are interested in is given by the vectors `canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis` (I think it's best to use the index: `K →+* ℂ`)

```lean
variable (K)

abbrev equivReindex : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ (ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) := by
  refine Fintype.equivOfCardEq ?_
  rw [Embeddings.card, ← finrank_eq_card_chooseBasisIndex, RingOfIntegers.rank]

abbrev basisMatrix : Matrix (K →+* ℂ) (K →+* ℂ) ℂ :=
  (Matrix.of fun i ↦ latticeBasis K (equivReindex K i)).transpose
```
then, the representation of `α` on the integral basis of `K` satisfies: 
```lean
example (α : K) : canonicalEmbedding K α = (basisMatrix K).mulVec
    (fun i ↦ (((integralBasis K).reindex (equivReindex K).symm).repr α i : ℂ)) := by
  ext
  rw [← (canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis K).sum_repr (canonicalEmbedding K α),
    ← Equiv.sum_comp (equivReindex K)]
  simp_rw [canonicalEmbedding.integralBasis_repr_apply, Matrix.mulVec, Matrix.dotProduct,
    basisMatrix, Matrix.transpose_apply, Matrix.of_apply, Finset.sum_apply, mul_comm,
    Basis.repr_reindex, Finsupp.mapDomain_equiv_apply, Equiv.symm_symm, Pi.smul_apply, smul_eq_mul]
```
Note that, for this last proof, there is a couple of results missing that should be added to `CanonicalEmbedding.Basic`:
```lean
theorem canonicalEmbedding.mem_rat_span_latticeBasis (x : K) :
    canonicalEmbedding K x ∈ Submodule.span ℚ (Set.range (latticeBasis K)) := by
  rw [← Basis.sum_repr (integralBasis K) x, map_sum]
  simp_rw [map_rat_smul]
  refine Submodule.sum_smul_mem _ _ (fun i _ ↦ Submodule.subset_span ?_)
  rw [← latticeBasis_apply]
  exact Set.mem_range_self i

theorem canonicalEmbedding.integralBasis_repr_apply (x : K) (i : ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) :
    (canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis K).repr (canonicalEmbedding K x) i =
      (integralBasis K).repr x i := by
  rw [← Basis.restrictScalars_repr_apply ℚ _ ⟨_, mem_rat_span_latticeBasis K x⟩, eq_ratCast,
    Rat.cast_inj]
  let f := (canonicalEmbedding K).toRatAlgHom.toLinearMap.codRestrict _
    (fun x ↦ mem_rat_span_latticeBasis K x)
  suffices ((latticeBasis K).restrictScalars ℚ).repr.toLinearMap ∘ₗ f =
    (integralBasis K).repr.toLinearMap from DFunLike.congr_fun (LinearMap.congr_fun this x) i
  refine Basis.ext (integralBasis K) (fun i ↦ ?_)
  have : f (integralBasis K i) = ((latticeBasis K).restrictScalars ℚ) i := by
    apply Subtype.val_injective
    rw [LinearMap.codRestrict_apply, AlgHom.toLinearMap_apply, Basis.restrictScalars_apply,
      latticeBasis_apply]
    rfl
  simp_rw [LinearMap.coe_comp, LinearEquiv.coe_coe, Function.comp_apply, this, Basis.repr_self]
```

@riccardobrasca I read somewhere on Zulip that you were involved with reviewing  [Siegel's lemma](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/SiegelsLemma.html) at LFTCM.

I am using the same reference in the description of this PR :  Keng, Hua Loo. "Introduction to Number Theory.", page 489, Springer-Verlag (1982)

I have the proof of the version of Siegel's lemma (Lemma 8.1  page 589)

Let $0 < M < N,$ and $a_{jk}$ be rational integers satisfying $\left| a_{jk} \right| \leq A \quad \text{where } 1 \leq A, \mbox { } 1 \leq j \leq M \text{ and } 1 \leq k \leq N.$ Then there exists a set of rational integers $x_1 ... , x_N,$ not all zero, satisfying $a_{j1}x_1 + \cdots a_{jN}x_N = 0, \mbox { } 1\leq j \leq M$ and $|x_k| \leq(NA)^{\frac{M}{N-M}}, \mbox { } 1\leq k \leq N.$

stated as follows

```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Pow.Real

open BigOperators

variable {α β : Type _} [Fintype α] [Fintype β] [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α]

theorem siegel (cardα : Fintype.card α = M) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = N)
  (h0M : 0 < M) (hMN : M < N) (a : Matrix α β ℤ) (A : ℝ)
  (hA : 1 ≤ A) (habs : ∀ (j : α) (k : β), abs (a j k) ≤ A) :
  ∃ (x : β → ℤ), (∃ k, x k ≠ 0) ∧ (a.mulVec x = 0) ∧
  (∀ k, |x k| ≤ (N * A) ^ ((M : ℝ)/ (N - M)) ) := by...
```

I want to use it in the proof of the following result (Lemma 8.2, page 590) : 

Let $0 < p < q,$ and $a_{kl}$ be rational integers satisfying $\overline{|a_{kl}|} \leq A$ where $A \geq 1$, $1 \leq k \leq p$  
and $1 \leq l \leq q.$ Then there exists a set of rational integers $\xi_1 \ldots, \xi_q,$ not all zero, satisfying $a_{k1}\xi_1 + \cdots + a_{kq}\xi_q = 0, \quad 1\leq k \leq p, \quad 1\leq l \leq q.$ and  $\overline{|\xi_l|} < c_1(1 + (c_1qA)^{\frac{p}{q-p}}).$

```lean
variable {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

open BigOperators Module.Free Fintype NumberField Embeddings FiniteDimensional
  Matrix Set Algebra Finset Polynomial Finset

variable {α β : Type _} [Fintype α] [Fintype β] [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α]
  {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

noncomputable abbrev c₂' := (@c K _ _ * maxFinFun (fun r => House (algebraMap (𝓞 K) K (b r))))

local notation "h" => finrank ℚ K

theorem lemma82
 (cardα : Fintype.card α = p) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = q)
  (h0p : 0 < p) (hpq : p < q) (a : Matrix α β (𝓞 K)) (A : ℝ) (hA : 1 ≤ A)
  (habs : ∀ k l, (House (a k l).1) ≤ A) :
  ∃ (ξ : β → 𝓞 K), (∃ l, ξ l ≠ 0) ∧ (∀ k, a.mulVec ξ k = 0) ∧
    ( ∀ l, House (ξ l).1 ≤ @c₂' K _ _* h * (1 + (q*(h*@c₂' K _ _)*A)^((p : ℝ)/(q-p)))) :=...
```
Lemma82 is one of the lemmas that I want to add in the API of the house and I now have to refactor it based on the changes. Do you have any advice on that? Should I just follow how Siegel's lemma is stated in mathlib ?

Hi!
Thanks @riccardobrasca for calling me.

I see that you need a version of the lemma `Int.Matrix.exists_ne_zero_int_vec_norm_le` that was added recently to Mathlib. 
When we started working on this project, for some reason we worked with matrices in `Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) ℤ` instead of `Matrix α β ℤ` for `[Fintype α] [Fintype β]` as you would like to have. It seems to me that this is the only relevant difference between the two versions. 
In any case, I have modified the file `SiegelsLemma` so that the main theorem is now the following
```lean
Int.Matrix.exists_ne_zero_int_vec_norm_le.{u_1, u_2} {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [Fintype α] [Fintype β]
  [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α] (m n : ℕ) (cardα : Fintype.card α = m) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = n) (A : Matrix α β ℤ)
  (hn : m < n) (hm : 0 < m) (hA_nezero : A ≠ 0) : ∃ t, t ≠ 0 ∧ A *ᵥ t = 0 ∧ ‖t‖ ≤ (↑n * ‖A‖) ^ ((m : ℝ) / (n - m))
```
which is, I think, very similar to what you want and specialises to the theorem currently on Mathlib. 

What do you think @mkaratarakis  and @riccardobrasca ?
I could make a PR if you agree.
If it is possible to have only one version that is general enough this would be the best solution. But no problem if we really need two versions.

Hi  @riccardobrasca 

If we consider this version of Siegel's lemma
```lean
Int.Matrix.exists_ne_zero_int_vec_norm_le.{u_1, u_2} {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [Fintype α] [Fintype β]
  [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α] (m n : ℕ) (cardα : Fintype.card α = m) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = n) (A : Matrix α β ℤ)
  (hn : m < n) (hm : 0 < m) (hA_nezero : A ≠ 0) : ∃ t, t ≠ 0 ∧ A *ᵥ t = 0 ∧ ‖t‖ ≤ (↑n * ‖A‖) ^ ((m : ℝ) / (n - m))
```
as @fbarroero suggests, what would be the statement of Lemma 8.2 that is most appropriate for mathlib ?

I could attempt to prove that instead and then see whether there are other things that need to be generalized.
I don't have any real preference, I just wanted to double check that we are not doing the same thing twice.

Here's an mwe for the ```basisMatrix``` : 

```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.Matrix
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.Basic

variable {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

namespace NumberField

noncomputable section

open Module.Free FiniteDimensional NumberField.canonicalEmbedding NumberField Matrix

/-- The house of an algebraic number as the norm of its image by the canonical embedding.-/
abbrev house (α : K) : ℝ := ‖canonicalEmbedding K α‖

variable (K)

/-- An equivalence between the set of embeddings of `K` into `ℂ` and the index set of the chosen
  basis of the ring of integers of `K`. -/
abbrev equivReindex : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ (ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) := Fintype.equivOfCardEq <|
  by rw [Embeddings.card, ← finrank_eq_card_chooseBasisIndex, RingOfIntegers.rank]

/-- The basis matrix for the embeddings of `K` into `ℂ`. This matrix is formed by
  taking the lattice basis vectors of `K` and reindexing them according to the
  equivalence `equivReindex`, then transposing the resulting matrix. -/
abbrev basisMatrix : Matrix (K →+* ℂ) (K →+* ℂ) ℂ :=
  (Matrix.of fun i ↦ latticeBasis K (equivReindex K i)).transpose

variable [DecidableEq (K →+* ℂ)]

theorem det_of_basisMatrix_non_zero : (basisMatrix K).transpose.det ≠ 0 := by
      let e : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K) := equivReindex K
      let N := Algebra.embeddingsMatrixReindex ℚ ℂ (fun i => integralBasis K (e i))
        RingHom.equivRatAlgHom
      rw [show (basisMatrix K).transpose = N by {
        ext:2; simp only [N, Matrix.transpose_apply, latticeBasis_apply, integralBasis_apply,
        Matrix.of_apply, apply_at]; rfl}, ← pow_ne_zero_iff two_ne_zero]
      convert (map_ne_zero_iff _ (algebraMap ℚ ℂ).injective).mpr
        (Algebra.discr_not_zero_of_basis ℚ (integralBasis K))
      rw [← Algebra.discr_reindex ℚ (integralBasis K) e.symm]
      exact (Algebra.discr_eq_det_embeddingsMatrixReindex_pow_two ℚ ℂ
        (fun i => integralBasis K (e i)) RingHom.equivRatAlgHom).symm

instance : Invertible (basisMatrix K) := Matrix.invertibleOfIsUnitDet _
    (Matrix.det_transpose (basisMatrix K) ▸ (Ne.isUnit (det_of_basisMatrix_non_zero K)))

variable {α : Type _} {β : Type _} [Fintype α] [Fintype β]
  [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α]

def newBasis := (RingOfIntegers.basis K).reindex (equivReindex K).symm

/-- The basisMatrix is nonzero. -/
theorem basisMatnotzero : (basisMatrix K) ≠ 0 := by {
  intros H
  rw [← Matrix.ext_iff] at H
  have hbasis := Basis.ne_zero (newBasis K)
  have : 0 < Fintype.card (K →+* ℂ) := by {
      exact Fintype.card_pos}
  rw [Fintype.card_pos_iff] at this
  let ⟨b⟩ := this
  apply hbasis b
  simp only [basisMatrix, latticeBasis_apply, integralBasis_apply, transpose_apply, of_apply,
    apply_at, zero_apply, _root_.map_eq_zero, RingOfIntegers.coe_eq_zero_iff, forall_const] at H
  unfold newBasis
  simp only [Basis.coe_reindex, Equiv.symm_symm, Function.comp_apply]
  exact H b}

attribute [local instance] Matrix.seminormedAddCommGroup

theorem one_le_norm_basisMatrix (hB : basisMatrix K ≠ 0) : 1 ≤ ‖(basisMatrix K)⁻¹‖ := sorry
```

Thanks for your contribution and welcome to mathlib!
I see your pull request has three errors - just in case you didn't see this already, [the documentation guidelines](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html) mention how to fix the first. (For the second one, you can simply re-wrap the line.)
You can fix the third one (you need to update the file `Mathlib.lean` to mention your new file) by running `lake exe mk_all`, for example. (Currently, that script has a small bug on windows - let me know if this programm fails and I can run it for you.)

Thanks for the contribution!
Please read the naming conventions [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) and adjust accordingly. Thanks again!
Can you please add a reference in the standard mathematical literature?

I have the feeling that it would make more sense to do all of this using [NumberField.canonicalEmbedding](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/NumberField/CanonicalEmbedding/Basic.html#NumberField.canonicalEmbedding). Then, you could define the house of an algebraic number as the norm of its image by the canonical embedding, say
```lean
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.Basic

variable {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

noncomputable section

namespace NumberField

open Module.Free NumberField FiniteDimensional NumberField.canonicalEmbedding

abbrev House (α : K) : ℝ := ‖canonicalEmbedding K α‖

theorem House_eq_sup' (α : K) :
    House α = Finset.univ.sup' Finset.univ_nonempty (fun φ : K →+* ℂ ↦ ‖φ α‖₊) := by
  rw [House, ← coe_nnnorm, nnnorm_eq, ← Finset.sup'_eq_sup Finset.univ_nonempty]
```

Then, the matrix you are interested in is given by the vectors `canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis` (I think it's best to use the index: `K →+* ℂ`)

```lean
variable (K)

abbrev equivReindex : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ (ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) := by
  refine Fintype.equivOfCardEq ?_
  rw [Embeddings.card, ← finrank_eq_card_chooseBasisIndex, RingOfIntegers.rank]

abbrev basisMatrix : Matrix (K →+* ℂ) (K →+* ℂ) ℂ :=
  (Matrix.of fun i ↦ latticeBasis K (equivReindex K i)).transpose
```
then, the representation of `α` on the integral basis of `K` satisfies: 
```lean
example (α : K) : canonicalEmbedding K α = (basisMatrix K).mulVec
    (fun i ↦ (((integralBasis K).reindex (equivReindex K).symm).repr α i : ℂ)) := by
  ext
  rw [← (canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis K).sum_repr (canonicalEmbedding K α),
    ← Equiv.sum_comp (equivReindex K)]
  simp_rw [canonicalEmbedding.integralBasis_repr_apply, Matrix.mulVec, Matrix.dotProduct,
    basisMatrix, Matrix.transpose_apply, Matrix.of_apply, Finset.sum_apply, mul_comm,
    Basis.repr_reindex, Finsupp.mapDomain_equiv_apply, Equiv.symm_symm, Pi.smul_apply, smul_eq_mul]
```
Note that, for this last proof, there is a couple of results missing that should be added to `CanonicalEmbedding.Basic`:
```lean
theorem canonicalEmbedding.mem_rat_span_latticeBasis (x : K) :
    canonicalEmbedding K x ∈ Submodule.span ℚ (Set.range (latticeBasis K)) := by
  rw [← Basis.sum_repr (integralBasis K) x, map_sum]
  simp_rw [map_rat_smul]
  refine Submodule.sum_smul_mem _ _ (fun i _ ↦ Submodule.subset_span ?_)
  rw [← latticeBasis_apply]
  exact Set.mem_range_self i

theorem canonicalEmbedding.integralBasis_repr_apply (x : K) (i : ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) :
    (canonicalEmbedding.latticeBasis K).repr (canonicalEmbedding K x) i =
      (integralBasis K).repr x i := by
  rw [← Basis.restrictScalars_repr_apply ℚ _ ⟨_, mem_rat_span_latticeBasis K x⟩, eq_ratCast,
    Rat.cast_inj]
  let f := (canonicalEmbedding K).toRatAlgHom.toLinearMap.codRestrict _
    (fun x ↦ mem_rat_span_latticeBasis K x)
  suffices ((latticeBasis K).restrictScalars ℚ).repr.toLinearMap ∘ₗ f =
    (integralBasis K).repr.toLinearMap from DFunLike.congr_fun (LinearMap.congr_fun this x) i
  refine Basis.ext (integralBasis K) (fun i ↦ ?_)
  have : f (integralBasis K i) = ((latticeBasis K).restrictScalars ℚ) i := by
    apply Subtype.val_injective
    rw [LinearMap.codRestrict_apply, AlgHom.toLinearMap_apply, Basis.restrictScalars_apply,
      latticeBasis_apply]
    rfl
  simp_rw [LinearMap.coe_comp, LinearEquiv.coe_coe, Function.comp_apply, this, Basis.repr_self]
```

@riccardobrasca I read somewhere on Zulip that you were involved with reviewing  [Siegel's lemma](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/SiegelsLemma.html) at LFTCM.

I am using the same reference in the description of this PR :  Keng, Hua Loo. "Introduction to Number Theory.", page 489, Springer-Verlag (1982)

I have the proof of the version of Siegel's lemma (Lemma 8.1  page 589)

Let $0 < M < N,$ and $a_{jk}$ be rational integers satisfying $\left| a_{jk} \right| \leq A \quad \text{where } 1 \leq A, \mbox { } 1 \leq j \leq M \text{ and } 1 \leq k \leq N.$ Then there exists a set of rational integers $x_1 ... , x_N,$ not all zero, satisfying $a_{j1}x_1 + \cdots a_{jN}x_N = 0, \mbox { } 1\leq j \leq M$ and $|x_k| \leq(NA)^{\frac{M}{N-M}}, \mbox { } 1\leq k \leq N.$

stated as follows

```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Pow.Real

open BigOperators

variable {α β : Type _} [Fintype α] [Fintype β] [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α]

theorem siegel (cardα : Fintype.card α = M) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = N)
  (h0M : 0 < M) (hMN : M < N) (a : Matrix α β ℤ) (A : ℝ)
  (hA : 1 ≤ A) (habs : ∀ (j : α) (k : β), abs (a j k) ≤ A) :
  ∃ (x : β → ℤ), (∃ k, x k ≠ 0) ∧ (a.mulVec x = 0) ∧
  (∀ k, |x k| ≤ (N * A) ^ ((M : ℝ)/ (N - M)) ) := by...
```

Here's an mwe for the ```basisMatrix``` : 

```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.Matrix
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.Basic

variable {K : Type*} [Field K] [NumberField K]

namespace NumberField

noncomputable section

open Module.Free FiniteDimensional NumberField.canonicalEmbedding NumberField Matrix

/-- The house of an algebraic number as the norm of its image by the canonical embedding.-/
abbrev house (α : K) : ℝ := ‖canonicalEmbedding K α‖

variable (K)

/-- An equivalence between the set of embeddings of `K` into `ℂ` and the index set of the chosen
  basis of the ring of integers of `K`. -/
abbrev equivReindex : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ (ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K)) := Fintype.equivOfCardEq <|
  by rw [Embeddings.card, ← finrank_eq_card_chooseBasisIndex, RingOfIntegers.rank]

/-- The basis matrix for the embeddings of `K` into `ℂ`. This matrix is formed by
  taking the lattice basis vectors of `K` and reindexing them according to the
  equivalence `equivReindex`, then transposing the resulting matrix. -/
abbrev basisMatrix : Matrix (K →+* ℂ) (K →+* ℂ) ℂ :=
  (Matrix.of fun i ↦ latticeBasis K (equivReindex K i)).transpose

variable [DecidableEq (K →+* ℂ)]

theorem det_of_basisMatrix_non_zero : (basisMatrix K).transpose.det ≠ 0 := by
      let e : (K →+* ℂ) ≃ ChooseBasisIndex ℤ (𝓞 K) := equivReindex K
      let N := Algebra.embeddingsMatrixReindex ℚ ℂ (fun i => integralBasis K (e i))
        RingHom.equivRatAlgHom
      rw [show (basisMatrix K).transpose = N by {
        ext:2; simp only [N, Matrix.transpose_apply, latticeBasis_apply, integralBasis_apply,
        Matrix.of_apply, apply_at]; rfl}, ← pow_ne_zero_iff two_ne_zero]
      convert (map_ne_zero_iff _ (algebraMap ℚ ℂ).injective).mpr
        (Algebra.discr_not_zero_of_basis ℚ (integralBasis K))
      rw [← Algebra.discr_reindex ℚ (integralBasis K) e.symm]
      exact (Algebra.discr_eq_det_embeddingsMatrixReindex_pow_two ℚ ℂ
        (fun i => integralBasis K (e i)) RingHom.equivRatAlgHom).symm

instance : Invertible (basisMatrix K) := Matrix.invertibleOfIsUnitDet _
    (Matrix.det_transpose (basisMatrix K) ▸ (Ne.isUnit (det_of_basisMatrix_non_zero K)))

variable {α : Type _} {β : Type _} [Fintype α] [Fintype β]
  [DecidableEq β] [DecidableEq α]

def newBasis := (RingOfIntegers.basis K).reindex (equivReindex K).symm

/-- The basisMatrix is nonzero. -/
theorem basisMatnotzero : (basisMatrix K) ≠ 0 := by {
  intros H
  rw [← Matrix.ext_iff] at H
  have hbasis := Basis.ne_zero (newBasis K)
  have : 0 < Fintype.card (K →+* ℂ) := by {
      exact Fintype.card_pos}
  rw [Fintype.card_pos_iff] at this
  let ⟨b⟩ := this
  apply hbasis b
  simp only [basisMatrix, latticeBasis_apply, integralBasis_apply, transpose_apply, of_apply,
    apply_at, zero_apply, _root_.map_eq_zero, RingOfIntegers.coe_eq_zero_iff, forall_const] at H
  unfold newBasis
  simp only [Basis.coe_reindex, Equiv.symm_symm, Function.comp_apply]
  exact H b}

attribute [local instance] Matrix.seminormedAddCommGroup

theorem one_le_norm_basisMatrix (hB : basisMatrix K ≠ 0) : 1 ≤ ‖(basisMatrix K)⁻¹‖ := sorry
```

```lean
/--The sup norm of a non-zero integer matrix is at least one  -/

theorem Int.Matrix.one_le_norm_A_of_ne_zero' (m n : ℕ)
(cardα : Fintype.card α = m) (cardβ : Fintype.card β = n)
  (A : Matrix  (α × (K →+* ℂ)) (β × (K →+* ℂ)) ℤ) (hA : A ≠ 0) : 1 ≤ ‖A‖ := by
  by_contra! h
  apply hA
  ext i j
  simp only [zero_apply]
  rw [norm_lt_iff Real.zero_lt_one] at h
  specialize h i j
  rw [Int.norm_eq_abs] at h
  norm_cast at h
  exact Int.abs_lt_one_iff.1 h
```
